questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'I will meet you _______ 5 o'clock (at/on).'
Spot the mistake: 'She is arriving in Tuesday.'
Change the sentence to include a preposition of time: 'Her birthday is April.'
Fill in the blank: 'They will go for a vacation _______ summer (in/on).'
Spot the mistake: 'He usually jogs at the morning.'
Change the sentence to include a preposition of time: 'The event takes place May.'
questions.answer: The event takes place in May.

questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'She will return _______ the afternoon (in/on).'
Spot the mistake: 'I have a meeting on 10:30 am.'
Change the sentence to include a preposition of time: 'We have a family gathering Christmas.'
questions.answer: We have a family gathering at Christmas.

questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'His presentation is scheduled _______ Monday (on/in).'
Spot the mistake: 'We will visit our grandparents at the weekend.'
Change the sentence to include a preposition of time: 'The concert will be held the evening.'
questions.answer: The concert will be held in the evening.

questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'The store is closed _______ Sundays (on/in).'
Spot the mistake: 'She was born in 1995, in April.'
Change the sentence to include a preposition of time: 'The workshop starts 9 am.'
Fill in the blank: 'I like to read _______ the evenings (on/in).'
Spot the mistake: 'He will be here on a moment.'
Change the sentence to include a preposition of time: 'We usually have a meeting Tuesday mornings.'
questions.answer: We usually have a meeting on Tuesday mornings.

questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'She has an appointment _______ the 15th of July (on/in).'
Spot the mistake: 'I usually take a nap at the afternoon.'
